title: VR Headset Test!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: - Today we are checking out two things: the Lenovo Mirage Solo with Daydream and the Lenovo Mirage Camera with Daydream. Both of these things are really exciting and they kind of work hand-in-hand. This is a VR 180 camera. So, I'm sure most of you guys are very familiar with 360 cameras where you can see everything. You may have seen some VR 180 where it's just kind of like-- 180 degrees, so it's not entirely all-around but it just gives you sort of that extra little bit of view. So not only am I excited to try this out, but I'm also excited to try out this headset because this is one of the world's first stand-alone Daydream headsets. You don't need a PC, you don't need a phone, you just need this headset and everything is built in here. A huge thank you to Lenovo for sponsoring this video and sending me these things to check out. I feel like I just keep talking and I'm not even opening, so let's open and chat more about what's inside. (upbeat music) Smells like fresh technology. I just, I don't know guys, if you've ever opened up a new piece of tech, it just has the new tech smell. It's like new car smell, but oh my goodness. It's so lovely. So here is what the inside of the box looks like. Here's the headset. One of the things that they were talking about that this features is it has a lot of extra paddings. We will be very comfortable. That's also another huge thing with some of the headsets, is they end up being heavy or not comfortable. This is supposedly perfectly balanced, so that if it is on your head, it's not going to be wobbling different ways and be uncomfortable. We will test that out and see if that is true. (upbeat music) Oops! That adjusts it to make it tighter or looser on your head. We've got an on button, and two volume buttons. We've got USPC. I'm assuming this is all of the... things that we need to power it. Oh, we've got what looks to be some headphones. This also appears to be a perfect length, so it's not too long, so you can just plug this in and you don't have too much extra chords or cables hanging out. This is the little remote. Power brick, USPC cable. Okay, I'm going to plug in the headset, charge it up for a bit while I open up the camera. So with this, it's pretty cool because you are capturing content in Google's 180 format. So if you have ever seen 180 content on YouTube, then you're very familiar with what I'm talking about. I really like 180 because I feel like sometimes 360 gives people too much freedom, so as a creator, this kind of limits you to what's in front of you and to the sides of you. So you can transfer all of your footage from this camera using the VR 180 app. (gasps) Here it is-- ooh, it's so cool. I've never really played around much with shooting 3D content, and this does shoot 3D, so you are able to view it in a VR headset. Obviously Lenovo wants us to use their Mirage Solo headset, but if you do have another headset already, you can still that content. And if you do view this content on your phone or computer, it does convert it to 2D so you will be able to actually enjoy watching whatever it is that was shot. Let's see what else is in here. Charging brick, another USPC cable. Looks like there's two batteries in here. Oh, oh there's a carrying pouch. It's got a little magnet right here, so you can put your little charging cables in here, you can put your camera in here. This is cool too because you can also live stream, which is pretty neat, I've actually never tried that either. It's your... USPC, micro SD card slot. So basically we let this headset charge for just a few minutes. Whew, I'm impatient. We need to try it out. Power button... Are you on? Oh, you're turning on! I'm gonna kinda set it up, test it out, and then hopefully any of the content that I do shoot on the 180 camera, I will a separate link in the description so you guys can go check that out. I'll also include some links to some of the creators that made videos with this headset and the camera, so you can check those out as well. Okay, so it's telling me that I need this. Oh wow, god, VR is so freaking cool. I thought the thing that's cool about this headset is it uses a new Google technology that allows you to have positional tracking. That normally was only something that you could get using PC and a bunch of sensors, but all of that technology is built into this headset. And a lot of times those sensors aren't able to tell where you are in space in virtual reality, so if you step forward, or even backward, or to the side, you duck, you dodge, this will be able to detect all of that with no sensors. While that's updating, we've got our VR 180 camera. What's cool about VR 180 is it's one of those things where you feel like you're actually in the room with a person, or maybe not with a person, but wherever the camera happens to be. The best shooting practices when you're shooting something in 180 is to keep the camera still, steady, and don't move it. You don't have to move this, because it's already capturing the whole world in front of you, right below you, above you. I pushed this to turn it on. And then there's an app I already downloaded; it's called the VR 180 app. So it's searching for my camera right now. What are you doing? System update installing. Where's my... oh my gosh.
